item.title: Modern Cat Furniture That Isn’t Ugly
item.content:encoded:
If you have cats then chances are you also have some ugly cat furniture that just doesn’t fit with your home design. Cat furniture like scratching posts, cat trees and litter boxes are essential to keep your cat enriched and happy. These are necessities for cats, so how can we integrate them into our homes and still look stylish?

We’ve scoured the internet looking for the best modern cat furniture that isn’t ugly. Check out our top finds below!

We take pride in our independent review process, and use it to recommend the best products online. If you buy something through our links, we may earn a commission at no cost to you.

Best Modern Cat Trees

  1. Bogarel CORK CONSTELLATION TREE

The Cork Constellation Tree by French design company Bogarel is exceptional. If you are serious about design, then this is the cat tree for you and your cat. The Constellation design cork cat tree is made up of two half-spheres and two cork trays from the Dehesa forest in Portugal and a chromed steel structure made in Italy. It is made with 100% European and recyclable materials. FSC guaranteed ash and cork: from protected forests.

2. MiaCara Torre Cat Scratching Post Cat Tree

The MiaCara Torre Cat Scratching Post Cat Tree was designed by Dutch designer Regina Mol. Miacara products are manufactured in Germany and Europe with great attention to detail and sustainability. This cat tree will blend in with even the most high end furniture. It’s made with bent plywood and felt; two classic materials heavily featured in Dutch design.

3. Tuft And Paw Sprout Cat Tree

This sculptural cat tree from Tuft and Paw is beautifully designed. It’s made with bent plywood in walnut or ash veneer and soft felt. This cat tree is stunning to look at but also very stable and durable thanks to its construction. It’s slim profile allows you to place it against a wall or window without the bulkiness you get from a standard cat tree.

4. Hicat 4 High Catapilla

Best Modern Cat Shelving

  1. Dote Wall Climbers

Dote was recently founded by London-based designers Nic Wallenberg and Helena Hedenstedt. Dote is on track to be completely sustainable. All of their products are vegan and are either partly or entirely made from recycled materials. The products are not available yet, but you can sign up to be added to their waitlist. In our opinion these are well worth the wait!

2. ModCatShop Umile Modular Cat Set

ModCatShop is a modular cat furniture company that creates all of their designs with sustainable materials. They are handmade in the USA. The Umile Modular Cat Set is a wall mounted cat tree that offers plenty of space for jumping, playing and lounging. It’s a fully equipped cat playground that is both functional and beautiful.

3. Tuft And Paw Plateau Modern Cat Perch

This cat wall shelf is beautifully designed. It’s shaped out of a single piece of wood with a cozy felt interior. It looks stylish and modern when mounted on your wall. Your cat will definitely be lounging in style. The installation is super easy, your feline friend can be enjoying a new view in minutes!

Best Modern Litter Boxes

  1. Cat Person Skylight Litter Box by Jason Wu

This litter box was designed by iconic designer, Jason Wu. This litter box is sleek and minimal, but highly functional. The enclosed litter box ensures your cat’s mess stays inside, but there is plenty of ventilation to keep your cat happy and healthy.

2. Tuft and Paw Nook Litter Box

The Nook Litter Box from Tuft and Paw is the ultimate sleek and simple design. It’s made out of aluminum with a removable top to make for easy cleaning. Many of the covered litter boxes on the market are made out of wood. We don’t recommend this as the wood can absorb waste becoming very worn over time. That’s why aluminum is such a fantastic option!

3. Modkat XL Litter Box

This litter box has to be our top pick for functionality! It’s the largest top entry litter box on the market. Not only can your cat enter from the top but also from the side making it fantastic for cats of all ages. This litter box has a reusable liner inside to keep your litter box clean. It also comes with a scoop that attaches to the side.

Best Modern Cat Beds

  1. E&Y Hammock Table- KOICHI FUTATSUMATA

This table should be on every cat owners list! It’s designed to function as a coffee table and cat hammock all in one. It’s made with a steel base, glass top and molded rattan hammock. This is the perfect solution for stylish integrated cat furniture.

2. Bludot Signal Small Dog Bed

Ok we know this bed is made for dogs but we think your cat will love it just as much! This bed comes in 5 different subtle color/material options, including velvet. Its two toned color adds a wonderful dimension. It is filled with a mix of fiber and down so your cat can get the ultimate in beauty rest.

3. Tuft and Paw Puff Cat Bed

If your cat is the lounging type, then this is the one. The material is super fluffy and cozy but still looks refined. The bed is made out of contoured foam so your cat is effortlessly cradled. We only wish this came in human size!

Conclusion

We hope you enjoyed our round up of the best modern cat furniture! For all things design and cats follow along on our Instagram @catio_inspiration. There you will find even more design worthy cat furniture and home ideas for you and your cat!

item.title: No Drill Cat Shelf in 2022
item.content:encoded:
Do you want to install cat shelving without the drilling, screws, or searching for studs?

Maybe you live in an apartment or rental that doesn’t allow for any changes to the walls?

Our rental friendly solutions will get your cat vertical in no time, and maybe even give your room an aesthetic boost!

We take pride in our independent review process, and use it to recommend the best products online. If you buy something through our links, we may earn a commission at no cost to you.

No Drilling Required

Since we don’t want to make a hole in the wall, and command strips won’t work, we’ll have to get a little creative with what we use as shelving. We don’t recommend purchasing the no drill floating cat wall shelves as they can be unsafe for your cat. They don’t offer enough support to hold your kitty’s weight especially when cats are jumping or playing. We’ve categorized some safe solutions below depending on the best fit for you and your cat.

Fastest option: Hanging Condo

Did you know there are hanging cat condos that can fit right over your door? This option requires almost no time to set up and is a great space saver! Our recommended option is made with durable material that can handle the wear and tear from your cats. It also has complete interior access to all levels.

Pro tip: Make sure to take measurements of your door before purchasing to make sure the hanging condo fits!

Best looking option: Bookshelf Cat Tree

Integrate cat spaces into an existing bookshelf! This is an excellent way to give your cat more space without creating holes in your wall. You can make a fun kitty playground by placing a cat tree next to your bookshelf. This creates an easy to navigate territory for your cat and gives them access to new spaces in your home.

Pro tip: We recommend spacing the cat tree about 12”-16” from your bookshelf, the vertical spacing between the top of the cat tree and your bookshelf should be about 12”-18” to ensure an easy jump for your cat.

You can also add a comfortable basket on top of your bookshelf as a nice cat cove to sleep in. We like this felt one from Amazon. It looks stylish but is also comfortable for your cat. Ikea also makes cubby cat houses that fit most bookcases. You can also add some carpet to the top of your bookshelf which gives your cat extra grip and a place to nap.

There are even bookshelves that are designed exclusively for your cat! This one from The Refined Feline is super stylish, it’s sure to impress you and your cat.


Cheapest option: Window Perch

These cat shelves attach to any glass surface, like a window, with strong suction cups! These are super handy if you can’t drill into your walls and also give your cat an excellent view for watching the world go by. You can buy multiple and configure them in any way you like. There are double stacked window perches like the one pictured below, great for a multi cat household. You can also purchase ones that fold down when not in use so you can close the blinds on your window. We recommend this one from Amazon.

Pro Tip: make sure you wipe down your windows with window cleaner prior to adding the shelves. You’ll want to make sure the surface you stick them to is clean to maximize the suction seal.

It’s a safe space for cats to play, relax and satisfy your cat's instinctual need to climb. But if you live in a smaller space, a large cat condo might not be ideal. Instead we recommend wall mounted cat shelves and perches!

Why does your cat need a wall shelf?

It’s your cat’s natural instinct to want to climb and be elevated. In the wild cats climb to avoid predators. Even though there aren’t predators in your home, cats still have the natural instinct to climb. Having elevated space for them gives them a place that’s away from dogs, kids or just extra space for some alone time.

In the wild cats use the higher vantage point to hunt and stalk prey. This gives them the best unobstructed view. Cats are also territorial by nature so having shelves gives your cats space to call dibs over!

Providing wall shelves in your home is essential for your cat’s enrichment!

For more information on this check out Jackson Galaxy’s article.

Are cat shelves safe?

Cat shelves are completely safe as long as they are installed and placed correctly. The cat shelves are places for your cat to both play and sleep. Since your cat might be jumping and running on the shelves, you should install them in safe areas. Place them away from areas where your cat could be in danger of getting injured or breaking something. Keep the shelves away from televisions, breakable items, stoves, frail furniture or beds.

How do I install cat shelves?

It’s helpful to plan your layout on your wall first. Our recommendation is to use painters tape or pencil to help outline where you will place your shelves.

Unless the directions say otherwise, you should always mount your cat shelves into studs to ensure they can support the weight of your cat. You can find the studs in your wall using a stud finder. Here’s our recommended stud finder.

Check out this article for a step by step guide on how to best install cat shelves.

If you don’t want to install them yourself, check out TaskRabbit.com for hired help.

How high is too high for a cat shelf?

Cats will want to climb as high as they can. To keep your cats safe make sure you arrange the cat shelves in a way that’s easy for your cat to navigate. In general we recommend the vertical spacing between shelves to be about 12-18” and the horizontal spacing to be about 12-16”. But keep in mind your cat’s ability when installing your shelves.

How can I install cat shelves without drilling holes into my walls?

There are plenty of ways to utilize your vertical space without drilling holes into your walls. An easy no drill cat wall shelf solution is to opt for the cat shelves that suction cups to glass surfaces, like a window. We recommend the Tuft and Paw perch, but there are lots of other options out there that are suitable. Check out this window cat shelf on Amazon that folds down when not in use, the ultimate space saver!

Another no drill solution is to purchase an over the radiator cat shelf like this one from Boareal, on Etsy. It fits over your radiator so no assembly or drilling is required. It’s easy to pick up and move and made of high quality materials.

You can also integrate cat spaces into an existing bookshelf. Ikea makes cubby cat houses that fit most bookcases. This is an easy solution to give your cat extra space, no drilling required! Just make sure your bookshelf is stable to ensure the safety of your cat.

There are also “over the door” cat trees that can be strapped to your doors and tension rod cat trees like this one that can be placed up against a wall. Both are excellent solutions and require no drilling!

If you want more detailed information on how to provide extra space for your cat without drilling, check out our article here.

Conclusion

Cat shelves are a fantastic way to enrich the life of you and your cat! They provide a safe place for your cat to rest or play. If you live in a small space they are ideal as they utilize vertical wall space instead of floor space. Overall, we think every cat needs some cat shelves to call their own.

We hope you enjoyed our picks for the 10 best cat wall shelves of 2022!
